text: One of our clients wants to create a password protected site and provide profiles of many companies to subscribers. I understand we can do that in HubSpot. But they want to provide a newsfeed once someone subscribes where the subscriber can have a portal/newsfeed where they can add their favorite profiles. Is that possible in HubSpot? If not any ideas to use another platform that provides this feature and connect to HubSpot?

Correct, in HubSpot, you can use Memberships to create a site for people to login and see restricted content pages. However, if you are looking to have something where users can create profiles, update their info and follow other users, you would be looking at alot of heavy customization and API work when using HS.

I would recommend using WordPress for this and then this plugin: <https://codecanyon.net/item/userpro-user-profiles-with-social-login/5958681?_ga=2.100973512.891747781.1543419392-1642825601.1543419392>
it looks like its something that may do everything you mentioned

Hello! Does anyone know if something like this doc from Vidyard exist on the HubSpot side since they launch the HubSpot Video feature? <https://knowledge.vidyard.com/hc/en-us/articles/360009871054-How-to-use-the-Vidyard-Player-API>
Could yall please help with <@UEE9HSQ4S>’s question <@UCV4WAGLC> <@U9F22AQH5>? :slightly_smiling_face: :pray:

Bot question: is there some sort of way to use some HubSpot API to allow a chat bot to pull in information on a clients Dashboard data? For example, we create a bot that a client could go to and it would ask them if they want to learn about how many new contacts were created this month, how many leads have moved on to MQLs, how many blog views they've generated, and other KPIs like that?

My assumption is that we'd create something that would pull data from HubSpot and then re-assign it as a custom contact property that would then just be displayed as a personalization token (while also assigning those values of those custom fields to the client's records in HubSpot).

I was literally just approached about this my upper management and was curious if someoone else had done this or had ideas about it

At INBOUND they did launch the ability to build custom bot actions that do use API's to pull data into conversational responses.

This is currently Enterprise level only - not sure if it will ever roll down to other product levels .
Luke, good to know about the Enterprise-only capability. Thanks!
